method.name: emulation_dhcp_group_config
method.description: This procedure configures and modifies a group of DHCP subscribers where each group share a set of common characteristics. This procedure can be invoked multiple times to create multiple groups of subscribers on a port with characteristics different from other groups or for independent control purposes. This command allows the user to configure a specified number of DHCP client sessions which belong to a subscriber group with specific Layer 2 network settings. Once the subscriber group has been configured, a handle is created which can be used to modify the parameters or reset sessions for the subscriber.

description.text: Note: ethernet_ii_qinq is not supported with IxTclHal. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.

choice.choiceText: Ethernet II with a single vlan tag
VC Mux IPv4 Routed (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
VC Mux Bridged Ethernet (FCS) (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
VC Mux Bridged Ethernet (no FCS). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
VC Mux IPv6 Routed (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
LLC Routed AAL5 Snap (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
LLC Bridged Ethernet (FCS) (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
LLC Bridged Ethernet (no FCS) (default for ATM cards). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
LLC Encap PPP (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.
VC Mux PPP (valid only for -version ixnetwork). Not supported in ixiangpf namespace.

restriction.value: ethernet_ii ethernet_ii_vlan ethernet_ii_qinq vc_mux_ipv4_routed vc_mux_fcs vc_mux vc_mux_ipv6_routed llcsnap_routed llcsnap_fcs llcsnap llcsnap_ppp vc_mux_ppp

description.text: Specifies the base (first) MAC address to use when emulating multiple clients. This parameter is mandatory when -mode is "create". Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.

Specifies the step value applied to the base MAC address for each subsequent emulated client. It must be provided in the integer format (unlike ixTclHal where it is provided in MAC address format). The step MAC address is arithmetically added to the base MAC address with any overflow beyond 48 bits silently discarded. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
Indicates the number of DHCP clients emulated. The default value is 4096. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
The Method used to increment VLAN IDs. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
The first VLAN ID to be used for the outer VLAN tag. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
The number of unique outer VLAN IDs that will be created. The default value is 4094. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
The first VLAN ID to be used for the inner VLAN tag. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The number of unique inner VLAN IDs that will be created. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The value to be added to the inner VLAN ID for each new assignment. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The value to be added to the outer VLAN ID for each new assignment. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
The vendor's registered Private Enterprise Number maintained by IANA. The default value is 10. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
DHCP Unique Identifier (DUID) Type. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The Option Request option is used to identify a list of options in a message between a client and a server. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The value by which the VENDOR-ID is incremented for each DHCP client. The default value is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
Identity Association (IA) Unique Identifier. This Id is incremented automatically for each DHCP client. The default value is 10. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The value by which the IA-ID is incremented for each DHCP client. The default is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The suggested time, in seconds, at which the client contacts the server to extend the lifetimes of the assigned addresses. The default value is 302400. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The suggested time, in seconds, at which the client contacts any available server to extend the lifetimes of the addresses assigned. The default value is 483840. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The Identity Association Type. The IA types are IANA, IATA, and IAPD. The default is IANA. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The maximum number of addresses/prefixes that can be negotiated by a DHCPv6 Client. The default value is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The number of IANA IAs requested in a single negotiation. The default value is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The number of IAPD IAs requested in a single negotiation. The default value is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The increment with which IAID is incremented for each IA solicited by a DHCPv6 Client. The default value is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
Defines the IP address version to be used for the range: IPv4 or IPv6. The default value is IPv4. Valid for IxTclNetwork.

When an address is allocated or reallocated, the client starts two timers that control the renewal process. The renewal process is designed to ensure that a client's lease can be extended before it is scheduled to end. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The address of the DHCP server from which the subnet will accept IP addresses. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
If enabled, the subnet accepts the IP addresses offered by the first server to respond to the DHCPDISCOVER message. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The maximum transmission unit for the interfaces created with this range. The default value is 1500. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
Enables or disables the use of the Vendor Class Identifier. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The vendor ID associated with the client. The default value is "Ixia". Valid for IxTclHal, IxTclNetwork.
How often a new outer VLAN ID is generated, if encapsulation is ethernet_ii_qinq. Valid for IxTclNetwork.

How often a new outer VLAN ID is generated, if encapsulation is ethernet_ii_vlan. Otherwise, specifies how often a new inner VLAN ID is generated, if encapsulation is ethernet_ii_qinq. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The 802.1Q priority for the inner VLAN. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The 802.1Q priority for the outer VLAN. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
Action to take on the port specified the handle argument.

choice.choiceText: only creates a DHCP Relay Agent stack, without the DHCP client behind it.
applies the parameters specified in subsequent arguments.
stops the emulation locally without attempting to clear the bound addresses from the DHCP server. This mode is only valid for IxNetwork-FT (P type of HLTSET).

description.text: Specifies the port and group upon which emulation is configured. If the -mode is "modify", -handle specifies the group upon which emulation is configured, otherwise it specifies the session upon which emulation is configured. Valid for IxTclHal and IxTclNetwork.
Enable DHCP Client to negotiate leases with rapid commit.
Name of the dhcp protocol as it should appear in the IxNetwork GUI.
If enabled, ask the server or relay agent to use the broadcast IP address in the replies.
Enable DHCP stateless.
Use DHCPc6-PD global addressing.
Defines the relay agent type to be used: normal or lightweight. The default value is normal. Valid only for dhcpv6. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
If true, the subnet will emulate a DHCP relay agent (added before the DHCP device group). Valid for IxTclNetwork.

The number of relay agents to use in this range. Note that the number of Ethernet or ATM interfaces used by a range has to be equal to the number of DHCP clients plus the number of relay agents, and the relay agent count cannot exceed the number of DHCP clients defined on the Ixia port. The default is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
If true, the DHCP plug-in overrides the VLAN settings, thereby allowing you to specify how VLANs are assigned. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The first (outer) VLAN ID to allocate to relay agent interfaces. The default is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The VLAN increment to use for relay interfaces. The default is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The number of different VLAN IDs to use. The default is 1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The address to which the requests from DHCP clients are forwarded. The default value is 20.0.0.1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.

The IP address of the first emulated DHCP Relay Agent. The DHCP network stack element will create one relay agent on each port contained in the current port and current range. The default value is 20.0.0.100. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The value by which to increment the IP address for each relay agent. The default value is 0.0.0.1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The network mask (expressed as a prefix length) used for all relay agents. The default value is 24. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The gateway address used for all relay agents. Default value is 20.0.0.1. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The Gateway IP Address for the session. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The Gateway Mac for the session. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
Enables users to manually set non-EUI link local addresses
Configures the Manual Link-Local IPv6 Address for the DHCPv6 Client.
The Gateway IPv6 Address for the session. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
The Gateway Mac for the session. Valid for IxTclNetwork.
If Enabled allows Reconfigure to be sent from server to Client via RelayAgent
Number of layer instances per parent instance (multiplier)

returnValue.value: A list containing the dhcpv6 iapd protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv6 iana protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
When status is failure, contains more info
Handle of the dhcp endpoint configured Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
Handle of any dhcpv4 endpoints configured
Handle of any dhcpv6 endpoints configured
Handle of any dhcpv4 relay agents configured
Handle of any dhcpv6 relay agents configured

notes.note: If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle

code_examples.example:
# Command :- Emulation Dhcp Group Config #This command will configure a DHCPv4 Client Group
${result} = Emulation Dhcp Group Config handle=<topology_handle> mac_addr=00:00:01:00:00:01 ... mac_addr_step=00.00.00.00.00.02 num_sessions=3 mac_mtu=1800 vlan_id=100 vlan_id_step=20 ... vlan_user_priority=2 dhcp_range_ip_type=ipv4 dhcp_range_renew_timer=10 dhcp_range_use_first_server=0 ... use_rapid_commit=1 protocol_name=dhcpv4client dhcp4_broadcast=1 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${dhcp_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} dhcp_status
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {'status' : '1' , 'dhcpv4client_handle' : 'dhcpV4Clienthandle'} # {handle {dhcpClientItemLevelhandles}} # This command will configure a DHCPv6 Client Group
${result} = Emulation Dhcp Group Config dhcp6_range_duid_enterprise_id=<multivalue_handle> dhcp6_range_duid_type=duid_llt ... dhcp6_range_duid_vendor_id=<multivalue_3_handle> dhcp6_range_ia_id=10 dhcp6_range_ia_id_increment=0 dhcp6_range_ia_t1=302400 ... dhcp6_range_ia_t2=483840 dhcp6_range_ia_type=iana dhcp6_range_max_no_per_client=1 dhcp6_range_iana_count=1 ... dhcp6_range_iapd_count=1 dhcp6_range_ia_id_inc=1 dhcp_range_ip_type=ipv6 dhcp_range_renew_timer=0 handle=<ethernet_handle ... use_rapid_commit=0 protocol_name={DHCPv6 enable_stateless=0 dhcp6_use_pd_global_address=0 use_custom_link_local_address=0 ... custom_link_local_address=<multivalue_4_handle> dhcp6_gateway_address=:: dhcp6_gateway_mac=00.00.00.00.00.00 dhcpv6_multiplier=1 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${dhcpv6client_1_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} dhcpv6client_1_status
# This command will generate output as given below # {'status' : '1' ,'dhcpv6client_handle' : 'dhcpv6ClientHandle', # 'dhcpv6_iapd_handle' : 'dhcp6IapdHandle', # 'dhcpv6_iana_handle' : 'dhcp6IanaHandle'}
